p.s: William Shakespeare'sSonnet 138 deals with rust and truthfulness in relationships.
The train of thought is set in the first quatrain of the sonnet.
The narrator explains how he/she, does not believe his/her partner to be truthful and therefore lies in the relationship as well.
Furthermore, it is explained in which way the persona of the poem lies, which is about their age.

The second quatrain expands the author's train of thought, by adding how the lyrical I is aware of his/her partner knowing the truth about their lies, but still both partner's resist on continuing with their untruthfulnessuntruthfullness.
In the final quatrain the lyrical I defends their communication in their relationship and explains that love is not defined by age.
The message of the sonnet is highlighted in the heroic couplet, that their lying sees aan untruthful standard but both partners are are happy with their relationship as it is.
